Commentary: a full swingy delivery to start. Full and swinging back in the air. Tamim drives but gets a thick inside edge into his boot.
Commentary_short: Malinga to Tamim Iqbal, no run

Commentary: and that's SL's first. Full and swinging in prodigiously. It was closer to the feet so Tamim was hustled for pace too. Swung back in the air by a stump or two. Tamim struggles to get his feet out the way and the ball sneaks between  bat and pad to hit middle and leg stump. Malinga is elated.
Commentary_short: Malinga to Tamim Iqbal, OUT

Commentary: attacking the stumps again. Full and straight, moving away outside off. Sabbir is watchful in defense
Commentary_short: Malinga to Sabbir Rahman, no run

Commentary: a slower delivery this time. 117 kph, slower yorker. Sabbir keeps it out
Commentary_short: Malinga to Sabbir Rahman, no run

Commentary: that's the change in length. A shorter delivery outside off that takes off and gains altitude as it flies over Kusal's head. Five wides. But a good change-up from Malinga
Commentary_short: Malinga to Sabbir Rahman, 5 wides

Commentary: leading edge and it lands safe! Full on middle and leg, Sabbir, instead of playing with a straight bat, closes the bat face too early. The top edge lands wide of cover. He gets a run too
Commentary_short: Malinga to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run

Commentary: dropped. A sitter. A clanger. Deceives Sarkar in pace. May have been pace off the ball, a slower delivery on off. Sarkar pokes and chips a ball straight back at Malinga who gets low to his left, but the ball hits the hard part of his palm and bursts out. Yikes.
Commentary_short: Malinga to Soumya Sarkar, no run

Commentary: nicely hit. Full on middle and leg, worked away through midwicket for three. The fielder dived to his left but somehow let the ball go through
Commentary_short: Kulasekara to Sabbir Rahman, 3 runs

Commentary: big appeal. No, says the umpire. That pitched outside leg. Full delivery on the pads, Sarkar misses a routine flick.
Commentary_short: Kulasekara to Soumya Sarkar, no run

Commentary: heaved over midwicket. Full delivery and straight, Soumya strides down and mows the ball over the in-field. Good hit
Commentary_short: Kulasekara to Soumya Sarkar, FOUR runs

Commentary: a slower delivery goes awry. Slips down leg for a wide
Commentary_short: Kulasekara to Soumya Sarkar, 1 wide

Commentary: good length delivery outside off, Soumya guides the ball wide of point for a couple to third man. Good running, nice intent
Commentary_short: Kulasekara to Soumya Sarkar, 2 runs

Commentary: 114 kph, deceived by pace again. Another slower delivery on off, Soumya lines a slog but toe-ends the ball down to third man instead
Commentary_short: Kulasekara to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run

Commentary: that's good batting. A length delivery outside off, dabbed down to third man for a run.
Commentary_short: Kulasekara to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run

Commentary: a dangerous stroke to the ball swinging away. But it's on the pads, full on leg, flicked to deep square leg
Commentary_short: Sanjaya to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run

Commentary: swing. But it's poor direction. Full, drifting down leg. Soumya tickles the ball fine. Off the pad or off the bat, doesn't matter. The result is four. Leg byes signalled
Commentary_short: Sanjaya to Soumya Sarkar, 4 leg byes

Commentary: that's poor bowling. The line was better. Starting that inswinger wide outside off, but he doesn't pitch the ball. A full toss is drilled through cover
Commentary_short: Sanjaya to Soumya Sarkar, FOUR runs

Commentary: good run. Full and swinging back in on off, dabbed to third man
Commentary_short: Sanjaya to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run

Commentary: sticks with the outswinger. Shortish delivery outside off, moving away. Dabbed to point
Commentary_short: Sanjaya to Sabbir Rahman, no run

Commentary: good finish. Length on middle and leg, defended into the leg side. Tidily played by these two
Commentary_short: Sanjaya to Sabbir Rahman, no run

Commentary: nope, poor again. Are they struggling with the grip? Full delivery waaay down leg. May have been close to a wide to a right-hander
Commentary_short: Kulasekara to Soumya Sarkar, 1 wide

Commentary: 78 mph, full on off, right in the slot for Sarkar who bottom-hand jabs the leather off the ball, but finds midwicket
Commentary_short: Kulasekara to Soumya Sarkar, no run

Commentary: better. That's more timing, than power. Full on middle and leg, worked away towards midwicket who dives to his right to save some runs
Commentary_short: Kulasekara to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run

Commentary: this is good, clever, thinking batting. Predicts where the ball could be. With this field, he's thinking something straight. So he dances down, and gives himself room. Gets something full and lofts the ball over cover for four.
Commentary_short: Kulasekara to Sabbir Rahman, FOUR runs

Commentary: that is good too. A low full toss on middle, worked towards midwicket for a run
Commentary_short: Kulasekara to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run

Commentary: this is really good from Bangladesh. Again, sees the field, anticipates a straight delivery. Gives himself room in the crease, and drills a drive through mid-off. Not great timing but enough
Commentary_short: Kulasekara to Soumya Sarkar, FOUR runs

Commentary: good batting again. Full and straight, pushed to mid-off for one. Essentially, they've made two extra runs by looking for singles after a boundary instead of blocking. The finer margins of T20 cricket
Commentary_short: Kulasekara to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run

Commentary: eeks. Sloppy, sloppy. A slower full toss outside off. Soumya guides the ball down to third man for a run. But the fielder, Sanjaya, fumbles and allows a second. So there's three extra runs for Bangladesh
Commentary_short: Malinga to Soumya Sarkar, 2 runs

Commentary: was there some bat on that? A slower delivery that is short. That's clever from Malinga. Sarkar gets a bit of bat on his attempted guide but the ball lands short of the keeper
Commentary_short: Malinga to Soumya Sarkar, no run

Commentary: carved past point. Three. Full and wide, Sarkar opens the face and slices the ball past backward point. Third man has to run around.
Commentary_short: Malinga to Soumya Sarkar, 3 runs

Commentary: no-ball. Free hit. Four. No, five. It's crazy. It's T20 cricket. Malinga loses control of his slower yorker, it's a very high full toss that Sabbir deflects down to short fine leg
Commentary_short: Malinga to Sabbir Rahman, (no ball) FOUR runs

Commentary: excellent execution. A wide yorker outside off, Sabbir stays in his crease, tries to get underneath the ball but fails to do so. A catch at cover, not legal of course
Commentary_short: Malinga to Sabbir Rahman, no run

Commentary: a mow attempted. Pace off the ball, slower ball on off. Sabbir mis-times his swat to mid-on
Commentary_short: Malinga to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run

Commentary: he takes Malinga on, and gets six for it. Malinga can't stem the runs either. 16 off it. A slower delivery on leg, Soumya lays into his flick and gets so much behind the ball that it clears square leg.
Commentary_short: Malinga to Soumya Sarkar, SIX runs

Commentary: good batting. Full outside off, pushed towards cover. Prasanna runs in and effects a direct hit at the bowler's end. And Sabbir is short. Looked like he was veering away, instead of going in straight lines. And that could have been the margin of a run and a wicket. Out comes the dab from Prasanna. That's not very good running, can't be let down by simple basics at this level.
Commentary_short: Sanjaya to Sabbir Rahman, OUT

Commentary: 128 kph, good length on middle and leg, pushed away towards cover
Commentary_short: Sanjaya to Soumya Sarkar, no run

Commentary: a wide yorker outside off, Soumya opens the bat face but fails to make contact. An optimistic appeal is quickly shot down. Bat hitting ground
Commentary_short: Sanjaya to Soumya Sarkar, no run

Commentary: a wide yorker. Good stuff. Sarkar mis-times his drive back to the bowler. Excellent execution
Commentary_short: Sanjaya to Soumya Sarkar, no run

Commentary: Bangladesh lose another. They're falling away. Is that a wise decision? It was good thinking but awful execution. The slower delivery on leg, Sarkar backs away and looks to hit the ball over mid-off, but can only skew the ball down the throat of long-on. He's thrown away a fantastic chance.
Commentary_short: Sanjaya to Soumya Sarkar, OUT
Dismissal_text: Soumya Sarkar c NLTC Perera b Sanjaya 29 (20b 3x4 1x6) SR: 145.00

Commentary: another good yorker, low full toss on off. Worked to square leg
Commentary_short: Mustafizur Rahman to Tharanga, 1 run

Commentary: that's four. Picks the length early. Picks the slower ball early. Picks the line early. Short on middle and leg, pulled down behind square. And his fast hands does the rest.
Commentary_short: Mustafizur Rahman to MDKJ Perera, FOUR runs

Commentary: shot of the day! And we've seen some pretty good ones. Very full, very straight. Kusal offers the full face and smashes an on-drive to long-on. All timing. Not often associated with Kusal
Commentary_short: Mustafizur Rahman to MDKJ Perera, FOUR runs

Commentary: full and wide, caressed to deep cover
Commentary_short: Mashrafe Mortaza to Tharanga, 1 run

Commentary: picks the gap again. Short on off, pulled in front of square for a couple. Nice
Commentary_short: Mashrafe Mortaza to MDKJ Perera, 2 runs

Commentary: powered through cover. Short of a length on off, Kusal stays back and flat-bats a slap between mid-off and cover
Commentary_short: Mashrafe Mortaza to MDKJ Perera, FOUR runs

Commentary: offcutter on off, pushed to long-off
Commentary_short: Mashrafe Mortaza to MDKJ Perera, 1 run

Commentary: Tharanga picks out short third man. Good length delivery outside off, gets some lift from the pitch. Tharanga can't keep his guide down. Picks out Mustafizur who dives forward and takes a neat catch. Too late?
Commentary_short: Mashrafe Mortaza to Tharanga, OUT
Dismissal_text: WU Tharanga c Mustafizur Rahman b Mashrafe Mortaza 24 (23b 4x4 0x6) SR: 104.34

Commentary: good length outside off, carved down to third man for one

Commentary: charges. But the length is shortish. So Munaweera guides a dab to third man

Commentary: carved away through backward point. A low full toss outside off, Kusal plays this late to get a couple

Commentary: slower ball outside off, slapped to long-on

Commentary: full and straight, a thick outside edge down to third man for one. Decent action, skiddy bowler

Commentary: hustles Kusal for pace. Back of a length on middle, pulled to long-on. Wanted to hit that midwicket area
Commentary_short: Mohammad Saifuddin to MDKJ Perera, 1 run

Commentary: good length. Munaweera backs away, Saifuddin follows him. Worked through backward square leg for four. Good batting.

Commentary: slower ball on off, pushed to long-off

Commentary: good length on leg, Munaweera punches to the sweeper cover

Commentary: slower delivery on middle, scythed to deep point

Commentary: a soft dismissal. Slower delivery again from Mortaza, Munaweera backs away and chips a simple return catch to Mortaza. Caught in two minds because of that wily line and length. Followed Munaweera, cramped him for room

Commentary: good length outside off, carved down to third man for a single

Commentary: out comes Kusal's strong bottom hand. Shortish outside off, pulled to deep midwicket

Commentary: another reverse-sweep, not needed. Flat on off, hit decently to short third man. But that's at least a productive area for Kusal

Commentary: absolute tripe. A filthy short delivery on leg, pulled to deep square leg

Commentary: too much flight, outside off. Nicely carved to deep point for a run

Commentary: a good decision. I've seen those given based on the ugliness of the shot. Flat delivery on leg, Kusal misses a reverse-sweep and is struck in front of leg. The appeal is turned down. Sliding down

Commentary: shot. Picks the length early, gets low and hammers a pull through square leg. Gets to fifty

Commentary: slowish delivery on the pads, Kusal misses a flick. Struck on the pads, maybe some bat too

Commentary: good length delivery outside off, nicely guided down to third man. Good technique he has Asela

Commentary: wow, he's so strong there. A full delivery on the pads, but that shot was made by his bottom hand. Picks the length, the line and whips the ball through midwicket. Hit it in the air, needs exceptional strength

Commentary: a slower ball down leg, off the pad to square leg. Playing it nicely

Commentary: slower delivery outside off, carved to the sweeper cover. Opened the face late

Commentary: good length delivery outside off, too much width. Slapped to the deep point fielder

Commentary: runs down and works the ball to deep midwicket

Commentary: the slider outside off, pushed to long-off

Commentary: good length delivery outside off, pulled to deep square leg. Just one

Commentary: a yorker to finish. Hit past the bowler for a run to long-on. That's very good bowling, didn't try too much. Just keeps Bangladesh in it for longer, take it late

Commentary: flat and wide outside off, skids on, no turn. Kusal misses his reverse sweep

Commentary: swats that into the gap for a couple. Gets down and heaves through midwicket. Mosaddek saves two

Commentary: lands in no-man's land. Flat on off, Kusal runs down and closes his bat face too early. Lobs in the air and falls safe

Commentary: fantastic shot. Flat delivery outside off, walks across, sees midwicket is up and then sweeps the ball over midwicket. Thinking batting

Commentary: tossed up outside off, driven to long-off

Commentary: overpitched outside off, hit to long-off for one. Decent over for SL, nine off it

Commentary: slower delivery and straight, Kusal gives himself room and hits the ball to cover. Decent areas.

Commentary: dropped! That should be taken at this level. Full delivery outside off, Kusal backs away, and slices a guide to short third man. Taskin somehow lets it go through his hands
Commentary_short: Mohammad Saifuddin to MDKJ Perera, 1 run

Commentary: why wasn't that out? He may still be out, though. Asela is run-out. A high full toss on middle and leg, Asela misses a flick. But did he get some bat on it. The ball ricochets towards cover. Asela isn't quick across the pitch, maybe because of the body blow he just wore. Labours towards the other end. Sabbir runs in from cover, picks up, turns around and effects a direct hit at the bowler's end to find Asela well short. That's fantastic fielding.
Commentary_short: Mohammad Saifuddin to Gunaratne, OUT
Dismissal_text: DAS Gunaratne run out (Sabbir Rahman) 17 (18b 1x4 0x6) SR: 94.44

Commentary: lovely batting. Full and straight, Kusal walks across and lofts the ball over cover. Exceptional stroke.

Commentary: slower ball on leg, pushed to long-off

Commentary: good stuff from Prasanna. Good length outside off, carved to point

Commentary: full delivery on off, inside-edged towards square leg for one. Very handy over for SL, 12 from it

Commentary: a slower offcutter outside off, Prasanna looks to lap the ball through fine leg but misses

Commentary: another dot. Good line. Full and wide from Mustafizur, Prasanna misses his drive. Three dots.

Commentary: charges down and drills a drive to long-off. Just one. One of four.

Commentary: a low full toss on middle and leg, heaved away to deep midwicket. Just one

Commentary: that's a match winner. Full delivery on middle, right in the slot. And boom. Off the middle of the bat and Prasanna's hoick goes way over midwicket for six. A stare from Prasanna.

Commentary: taken. Good bowling from Taskin. Back o a length on middle, Kusal backs away, looks to hit the ball straight but can only lob the ball to Soumya at mid-off. One of a very few deliveries Kusal has mis-timed. A special innings from Kusal.
Commentary_short: Taskin Ahmed to MDKJ Perera, OUT
Dismissal_text: MDKJ Perera c Soumya Sarkar b Taskin Ahmed 77 (53b 9x4 1x6) SR: 145.28

Commentary: full delivery outside off, in the arc. Prasanna misses his swing.

Commentary: how? how? How did he get so much power on that? Wow. A low full toss, Prasanna just lifts the ball over long-on. 87 metres. Sublime hitting
Commentary_short: Taskin Ahmed to Prasanna, SIX runs

Commentary: a slower delivery outside off, hammered past the bowler. The mid-off fielder dives to his right to delay the conclusion
Commentary_short: Taskin Ahmed to Prasanna, 1 run

Commentary: that's that. A low full toss from Taskin, Thisara watches the ball onto his bat and punches a lofted drive over mid-on for four. Sri Lanka take an unassailable lead in the T20 series.
Commentary_short: Taskin Ahmed to NLTC Perera, FOUR runs
